data.text: Camp Food Spices Apart from Salt and Pepper?
Hello from OZ, Apart from salt and pepper. What another spices do you travel with?
Hot pepper (the one that burns the tongue üòÇ)and olive oil.
data.author: Georges Froidevaux

data.text: Chili, italian herbs and ras el hanout or another couscous/bulgur spice :-)
data.author: Marloes Fraij

data.text: Chilli, cinnamon, mixed herbs (Italian).
data.author: Vanessa Mercer

data.text: Pepper?
data.author: Wai Sing Lee

data.text: Cinnamon, it keeps the goannas out of your pack
data.author: Cliff Weier

data.text: Smoked paprika - makes everything taste like a bbq mmmm
data.author: Saf Flatters

data.text: Salt pepper and cayenne pepper
data.author: Josh Kebschull

data.text: Normally a small pot of some kind of curry mix and the same with mixed herbs.
data.author: Paula Roberts

data.text: Salt, pepper, Italian herb mix, paprika, chili flakes, curry powder for sure. Maybe cinnamon, and cocoa powder (not a spice I know). I would also carry tomato paste. A teaspoon of cocoa powder in the cold soaked oats steps them up into something extra. It can also be an alternative to hot chocolate drink. Cocoa also hits the chocolate fix spot, without the weight and it doesn't melt in the heat. Were I live chocolate is not always available in rural areas.
data.author: Mark Perry

data.text: Beer
data.author: Mark Steenson

data.text: Hemp

data.text: herb mix (herbes de Provence) and perhaps paprika

data.text:
I make spice mixes that I like. My favorite is Emeril‚Äôs Essence. You can buy it pre-mixed in America, but here‚Äôs the recipe: https://www.food.com/recipe/emerils-essence-5031

data.text: salt & more salt.
data.author: Brian Gallagher

data.text: Aleppo pepper flakes and fresh garlic. Aleppo flakes are milder than regular chili flakes, so you can better control the heat. Just add more if you want to turn up the heat. If I want fresh herbs I will buy them along the way.

data.text: Espelette pepper, herbs from Provence, curry/ras-el-hanout are usually my go-to spices

data.text: Crushed red pepper, and a small bottle of hot sauce. Other condiments, mustard, ketchup, mayo, pickle relish are readily available at most every C-store, so no need to carry them until you feel you will use them.

data.text: None for me - but I wouldn't mind travelling with Ginger Spice!

data.text: Bit odd that some people are mentioning garlic and olive oil. They aren't spices. Is this an American thing? I take: Ground cumin Ground coriander Hot chilli powder Curry powder Smoked paprika
